docs.snippet: In the Senate yesterday, Mr. SUMNER presented a petition from Dr.CHEEVER and others, for the release of THADDEUS HYATT. After considerable debate it was referred to the Select Committee.

docs.snippet: The Commissioners for adjusting the damages accruing in consequence of the Quarantine, trouble in 1858 met yesterday, at 11 o'clock. Mr. JOHNSON announced that the Board had come to a decision upon Capt. NELSON'S Claim, which he would give as soon as...

headline.main: LOSSES BY THE QUARANTINE RIOTS.; CLAIMS OF THE COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION. AND OTHERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners for adjusting the damages accruing in consequence of the Quarantine, trouble in 1858 met yesterday, at 11 o'clock. Mr. JOHNSON announced that the Board had come to a decision upon Capt. NELSON'S Claim, which he would give as soon as Mr. HARVEY, one of the Commissioners' should arrive. Meantime, he presented the claim of GEORGE W. F. RANDOLPH.

docs.snippet: --We published yesterday morning an interesting letter from Hon. H.S. RANDALL concerning Lord MACAULAY's letter to him, published some weeks since, on the political institutions of the United States. It will be remembered that two or three English...
docs.lead_paragraph: --We published yesterday morning an interesting letter from Hon. H.S. RANDALL concerning Lord MACAULAY's letter to him, published some weeks since, on the political institutions of the United States. It will be remembered that two or three English writers intimated that these were not the settled and matured opinions of the great historian. Mr. RANDALL disposes of this pretext very thoroughly. He publishes extracts of other ...
